wikitext.*:
The '''Four Wise Clerks of Oxenford''' were the authorities whom the author of ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]'' apparently consulted for the exact definition of a [[Blunderbuss]], which was the weapon [[Farmer Giles]] used to chase away the [[The Giant|giant]] who came to the village of [[Ham]].<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]''</ref>

The definition of "blunderbuss" is directly taken from the ''[[Oxford English Dictionary]]'', and the four clerks are presumably [[James A. H. Murray]], [[Henry Bradley]], [[W. A. Craigie]], and [[C. T. Onions]], the four editors of the dictionary.<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]], [[Christina Scull]] (eds.), ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham#50th Anniversary Edition|Farmer Giles of Ham]]'', Notes, page 111 (50th anniversary edition, 1999)</ref>
